meanings.definition: To straighten or unfold something that has been rolled up.
meanings.sent1: She was unrolling the map to find the right direction.
meanings.sent2: He unrolled the scroll to read the ancient writing.
meanings.sent3: The magician unrolled the long scarf, but it kept getting longer and longer!
meanings.sent4: As the story unfolded, it felt like unrolling a mysterious scroll of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals unrolling in the morning sun was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To reveal or disclose something gradually.
meanings.sent1: The detective was unrolling the case details one by one.
meanings.sent2: The artist unrolled the canvas to show the masterpiece hidden within.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party plan was unrolling perfectly without any hitches.
meanings.sent4: Her life story unrolled like a captivating movie plot.
meanings.sent5: The mystery unraveled slowly, each clue unrolling a new twist.

meanings.definition: To spread out or extend something that was previously rolled up.
meanings.sent1: The carpet unrolled smoothly across the floor.
meanings.sent2: He unrolled the yoga mat before starting his practice.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket unrolled with a satisfying rustle.
meanings.sent4: The red carpet unrolled before the glamorous event.
meanings.sent5: The banner unrolling at the ceremony displayed a message of unity.
